trans-unit.source: Learning with Counts
trans-unit.target: Learning with Counts

trans-unit.source: Data Transformation / Learning with Counts
trans-unit.target: Data Transformation / Learning with Counts

trans-unit.source: Learning with counts is an efficient way to create a compact set of features for a dataset, based on counts of the values.
trans-unit.target: Learning with counts is an efficient way to create a compact set of features for a dataset, based on counts of the values.

trans-unit.source: You can use the modules in this section to build a set of counts and features, and later update the counts and the features to take advantage of new data, or merge two sets of count data.
trans-unit.target: You can use the modules in this section to build a set of counts and features, and later update the counts and the features to take advantage of new data, or merge two sets of count data.

trans-unit.source: The basic idea underlying <newTerm>count-based featurization</newTerm> is simple: by calculating counts, you can quickly and easily get a summary of what columns contain the most important information.
trans-unit.target: The basic idea underlying <newTerm>count-based featurization</newTerm> is simple: by calculating counts, you can quickly and easily get a summary of what columns contain the most important information.

trans-unit.source: Bascially, you count the number of times a value appears, and then use that information as a feature for input to a model.
trans-unit.target: Bascially, you count the number of times a value appears, and then use that information as a feature for input to a model.

trans-unit.source: Example of Count-Based Learning
trans-unit.target: Example of Count-Based Learning

trans-unit.source: Imagine you’re trying to validate a credit card transaction.
trans-unit.target: Imagine you’re trying to validate a credit card transaction.

trans-unit.source: One crucial piece of information is where this transaction came from, and one of the most common encodings of that location is the postal code.
trans-unit.target: One crucial piece of information is where this transaction came from, and one of the most common encodings of that location is the postal code.

trans-unit.source: However, there might be as many as 40,000 postal codes, zip codes, and geographical codes to account for.
trans-unit.target: However, there might be as many as 40,000 postal codes, zip codes, and geographical codes to account for.

trans-unit.source: Does your model have the capacity to learn 40,000 more parameters?
trans-unit.target: Does your model have the capacity to learn 40,000 more parameters?

trans-unit.source: If you give it that capacity, do you now have enough training data to prevent it from overfitting?
trans-unit.target: If you give it that capacity, do you now have enough training data to prevent it from overfitting?

trans-unit.source: If you had really good data with lots of samples, such fine-grained local granularity could be quite powerful.
trans-unit.target: If you had really good data with lots of samples, such fine-grained local granularity could be quite powerful.

trans-unit.source: However, if you have only one sample of a fraudulent transaction from a small locality, does it mean that all of the transactions from that place are bad, or that you don’t have enough data?
trans-unit.target: However, if you have only one sample of a fraudulent transaction from a small locality, does it mean that all of the transactions from that place are bad, or that you don’t have enough data?

trans-unit.source: One solution to this conundrum is to learn with counts.
trans-unit.target: One solution to this conundrum is to learn with counts.

trans-unit.source: That is, rather than introduce 40,000 more features, you can observe the counts and proportions of fraud for each postal code.
trans-unit.target: That is, rather than introduce 40,000 more features, you can observe the counts and proportions of fraud for each postal code.

trans-unit.source: By using these counts as features, you gain a notion of the strength of the evidence for each value.
trans-unit.target: By using these counts as features, you gain a notion of the strength of the evidence for each value.

trans-unit.source: Moreover, by encoding the relevant statistics of the counts, the learner can use the statistics to decide when to back off and use other features.
trans-unit.target: Moreover, by encoding the relevant statistics of the counts, the learner can use the statistics to decide when to back off and use other features.

trans-unit.source: Count-based learning is very attractive for many reasons: You have fewer features, requiring fewer parameters, which makes for faster learning, faster prediction, smaller predictors, and less potential to overfit.
trans-unit.target: Count-based learning is very attractive for many reasons: You have fewer features, requiring fewer parameters, which makes for faster learning, faster prediction, smaller predictors, and less potential to overfit.

trans-unit.source: How Counts are Created
trans-unit.target: How Counts are Created

trans-unit.source: An example might help to demonstrate how count-based features are created and applied.
trans-unit.target: An example might help to demonstrate how count-based features are created and applied.

trans-unit.source: This example is highly simplified, to give you an idea of the overall process, and how to use and interpret count-based features.
trans-unit.target: This example is highly simplified, to give you an idea of the overall process, and how to use and interpret count-based features.

trans-unit.source: Suppose you have a table like this, with labels and inputs
trans-unit.target: Suppose you have a table like this, with labels and inputs

trans-unit.source: Label column
trans-unit.target: Label column

trans-unit.source: Input value
trans-unit.target: Input value

trans-unit.source: A
trans-unit.target: A

trans-unit.source: A
trans-unit.target: A

trans-unit.source: A
trans-unit.target: A

trans-unit.source: B
trans-unit.target: B

trans-unit.source: B
trans-unit.target: B

trans-unit.source: B
trans-unit.target: B

trans-unit.source: B
trans-unit.target: B

trans-unit.source: Here is how count-based features are created:
trans-unit.target: Here is how count-based features are created:

trans-unit.source: Each case (or row, or sample) has a set of values in columns.
trans-unit.target: Each case (or row, or sample) has a set of values in columns.

trans-unit.source: Here, the values are A, B, and so forth.
trans-unit.target: Here, the values are A, B, and so forth.

trans-unit.source: For a particular set of values, you find all the other cases in that dataset that have the same value.
trans-unit.target: For a particular set of values, you find all the other cases in that dataset that have the same value.

trans-unit.source: In this case, there are three instances of A and four of B.
trans-unit.target: In this case, there are three instances of A and four of B.

trans-unit.source: Next, you count their class memberships as features in themselves.
trans-unit.target: Next, you count their class memberships as features in themselves.

trans-unit.source: In this case, you get a small matrix, in which there are 1 cases where A=0, 1 case where A = 1, 1 case where B= 0, and 3 cases where B = 1.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you get a small matrix, in which there are 1 cases where A=0, 1 case where A = 1, 1 case where B= 0, and 3 cases where B = 1.

trans-unit.source: When you create features based on this matrix, you get a variety of count-based features, including a calculation of the log-odds ratio as well as the counts for each target class:
trans-unit.target: When you create features based on this matrix, you get a variety of count-based features, including a calculation of the log-odds ratio as well as the counts for each target class:

trans-unit.source: Label
trans-unit.target: Label

trans-unit.target: 0_0_Class000_Count

trans-unit.source: List of Modules
trans-unit.target: List of Modules

trans-unit.source: The Learning with Counts category includes the following modules:
trans-unit.target: The Learning with Counts category includes the following modules:

trans-unit.source: Module
trans-unit.target: Module

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Creates a count table and count-based features from a dataset, and saves it as a transformation
trans-unit.target: Creates a count table and count-based features from a dataset, and saves it as a transformation

trans-unit.source: Exports count table from a counting transform
trans-unit.target: Exports count table from a counting transform

trans-unit.source: This module supports backward compatibility with experiments that create count-based features using <link xlink:href="166586ff-5bba-46a9-b469-20179f179b6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Build count table</link> and <link xlink:href="217741b5-730a-4c4b-839c-93c9cbb80ae7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Count Featurizer</link>.
trans-unit.target: This module supports backward compatibility with experiments that create count-based features using <link xlink:href="166586ff-5bba-46a9-b469-20179f179b6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Build count table</link> and <link xlink:href="217741b5-730a-4c4b-839c-93c9cbb80ae7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Count Featurizer</link>.

trans-unit.source: Imports an existing count table
trans-unit.target: Imports an existing count table

trans-unit.source: This module supports backward compatibility with experiments that create count-based features using <link xlink:href="166586ff-5bba-46a9-b469-20179f179b6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Build count table</link> and <link xlink:href="217741b5-730a-4c4b-839c-93c9cbb80ae7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Count Featurizer</link>.
trans-unit.target: This module supports backward compatibility with experiments that create count-based features using <link xlink:href="166586ff-5bba-46a9-b469-20179f179b6c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Build count table</link> and <link xlink:href="217741b5-730a-4c4b-839c-93c9cbb80ae7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Count Featurizer</link>.

trans-unit.source: It supports conversion of count tables to count transformations.
trans-unit.target: It supports conversion of count tables to count transformations.

trans-unit.source: Merges two sets of count-based features
trans-unit.target: Merges two sets of count-based features

trans-unit.source: Modifies count-based features derived from an existing count table
trans-unit.target: Modifies count-based features derived from an existing count table
